com.bitwise.decaf.editor
Class Utils.ListModel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bitwise.decaf.editor.Utils.ListModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ListModel, Utils.List.Listener
Enclosing class:
Utils
public static class Utils.ListModel
extends Object
implements ListModel, Utils.List.Listener

A ListModel based on a List, which may be applied to the model at any time. Numerous convenience methods are implemented. The modification of a region is reported to the listeners as a series of individual modifications, which is so much easier than the suggested mechanism that I wonder why anyone would implement anything different. If you know of a good reason, please tell me.

Method Detail

base

public Utils.List base()
Obtain reference to this ListModel's base.

moveUp

public void moveUp(int[] indices)
Move the elements at the specified indices up one step if possible. Will move as many elements in a multiple discontiguous selection as have a place to go. Will of course never change the order of any items within their respective selected or non-selected set.

moveDown

public void moveDown(int[] indices)
Move the elements at the specified indices down one step if possible. Will move as many elements in a multiple discontiguous selection as have a place to go. Will of course never change the order of any items within their respective selected or non-selected set.

remove

public Collection remove(int[] indices)
Remove the list elements at indices.

setBase

public void setBase(Utils.List base)
Replace the existing basis of this ListModel with base, notifying listeners as if the entire interval [0, base.size()-1] has been added.
